[[AVH data providers]]

== Delivery mechanism ==
AVH data is delivered to ALA in the form of Darwin Core Archives, the structure of which is described on a separate subpage, [[/Darwin_Core_Archive|Darwin Core Archive]].

====eventDate====
{| class="wikitable"  width="100%"
|-
! HISPID 5
| [[hispid:cdat|cdat]], [[hispid:cdat2|cdat2]]
|-
! width="15%" | ABCD / HISPID 5
| width="85%" | [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0863 abcd://Unit/Gathering/DateTime/ISODateTimeBegin]<br/>[http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0866 abcd://Unit/Gathering/DateTime/ISODateTimeEnd]
|-
! Darwin Core
| [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/eventDate dwc:eventDate]
|}
'''Notes'''
* Collecting start date and end date are combined in this concept. In Darwin Core, as in ISO 8601 intervals, they are separated by a slash.
* Note that incomplete dates (like '2000-11', '2007') can and should be delivered in the IsoDateTime concepts, both for collecting and determination date. This means that the date fields in your BioCASe tables can not be of the datetime types, but have to be text strings, as otherwise either your DBMS won't let you store incomplete dates, or the BioCASe provider will not let them through, as the database's incomplete dates are not valid XML dateTimes. 
&nbsp;

{| class="wikitable"  width="100%"

| width="85%" | &ndash;

| http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/georeferencedBy

'''Notes''':
* The HISPID [[HISPID_5_for_HISPID_Users#geosou|Geocode Source]] is a mixed concept, as it is a mixture of by whom and how the record was georeferenced. In Darwin Core we map the items 'collector' and 'compiler' to [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/georeferencedBy dwc:georeferencedBy] and the items 'generalised arbitrary point', 'automatically generated', 'gps' and 'topo' to [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/georeferenceProtocol dwc:georeferenceProtocol] ([[#georeferenceProtocol|next element]])
* There is currently no element in ABCD to indicate who provided the georeference. This would be a good candidate for addition in a future version.

HISPID also has the following elements that together can make up the habitat description. Of these [[hispid:top|Topography]] and [[hispid:asspp|Associated Taxa]] have Darwin Core equivalents. For AVH we could either concatenate all other elements into [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/habitat dwc:habitat] or see to what extent the Darwin Core [http://darwincore.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/terms/index.htm#MeasurementOrFact MeasurementOrFact] class is available to us.

| width="85%" | [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1335 abcd://Unit/Gathering/Notes]
|- 
! Darwin Core
| 
|}
'''Notes'''
* We need to discuss our Notes fields. To me the HISPID [[hispid:cnot|Collection notes (cnot)]] are [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/occurrenceRemarks occurrenceRemarks], but in Darwin Core [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/occurrenceRemarks occurrenceRemarks] is mapped to the ABCD [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1433 abcd://Unit/Notes] while [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/eventRemarks eventRemarks] is mapped to [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1335 abcd://Unit/Gathering/Notes]. In HISPID 5 [[hispid:misc|Miscellaneous notes (misc)]] is mapped to [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1433 abcd://Unit/Notes].
* In any case, I think we should use both elements, which we haven't done so far. AD and DNA deliver [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1433 abcd://Unit/Notes] as well as [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept1335 abcd://Unit/Gathering/Notes], but the former has been ignored in the aggregation script (because I only just worked out what it meant).
&nbsp;

===Current Determination===
The current determination is stored in the [[#Core_file|Core file]], while previous determinations are stored in
the [[#Determination_History_Extension_file|Determination  History Extension file]]. If there is a single determination per record, this determination
will be considered the current determination, no matter whether the PreferredFlag has been set or not.

'''Notes''':
* In Darwin Core determination qualifier works differently from ABCD. In Darwin Core the identification qualifier consists of the qualifier plus all parts of the name that come after it. This will be concatenated from the atomised name using the insertion point to know where to start. If the insertion point (or even the qualifier) is not provided, we'll try to reconstruct it from the scientific name string. We also deliver the ABCD terms, as they are easier to work with.

=== Identification history ===

We currently present this as a separate [[#Determination History Extension file|file]] in the Darwin Core Archive, which is stored, but which otherwise ALA can't do anything with it. There is a Darwin Core element [http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/previousIdentifications dwc:previousIdentifications] that I propose to concatenate the determination history into. Preferred delivery method is still using the ABCD [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0287 //Unit/Identifications/Identification/*] elements listed above, using one [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0287 Identification] element for each determination and with the [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0345 //Unit/Identifications/Identification/PreferredFlag] set to FALSE, but for herbaria that can't provide identification history in atomised form (but can as a string) the ABCD [http://wiki.tdwg.org/twiki/bin/view/ABCD/AbcdConcept0399 //Unit/Identifications/IdentificationHistory] element is available.

===Denormalised Named Areas===

None of the following elements is actually used by ALA, but they are included in the Darwin Core Archive we deliver to ALA anyway. They may also serve a purpose for exchange between herbaria.

Question:  what is the implication of this for specimens lacking georeference data?  I assume this means that these specimens will lack that information, however these regions may be signficant for users attempting to find data (e.g., NZ Ecological regions) ([[User:AWilton|AWilton]] 12:35, 19 March 2013 (EST))
